item.title: Week 2b: You are as good as your game
item.description: Day 10 of tennis Day 10 of formal tennis on June 17, 2020. Following learnings from today: It was just an average play today. Got a chance to play rallies with a senior coach and realized that one is as good as one’s game. Loss of focus and technique: The alertness and awareness converts into caution causing unforced errors and miscalculations. The placement judgement dips and thus the quality of shots deteriorates.

item.title: Week 2: Improving the game
item.description: Day 8 of tennis Day 8 of formal tennis on June 15, 2020. Following are the improvements from last week: Better judgement of the ball: The best position for a forehand or backhand is the max height of ball at the abdomen level provides ideal control and swing. The ball position with the right tilted face and lower to upper swing of the racquet generates the right momentum for the ball to cross the net.

item.title: Week 1: For the love of tennis
item.description: Day 4 of tennis Day 4 of formal tennis learning on June 8, 2020. While the first day gives you a lot of confidence as you start hitting the ball, it is not soon that you realize in the 3rd or 4th day the importance of technique in the game. Below are the 4 key learnings that I got for a beginner level tennis player: Stance: The key element to understand both fore-hand and back-hand hitting in tennis is the stance or the body position wrt to the ball.
